answers.answer: Hello,After reading your symptoms,the possibility of fungal infection(tinea cruris/jock itch) is coming to my mind. Wash your groin daily and then dry thoroughly by pat drying,not rubbing.The damp groin is an ideal site for fungi to multiply.Also wear cotton underwears and do not share other people’s towels. Most forms of jock itch respond to over-the-counter products, which contain any of several basic ingredients: miconazole, tolnaftate, terbinafine, and clotrimazole.http://www.thirdage.com/exercise-fitness/tinea-cruris-aka-jock-itchOther possibilities are xerotic eczema,senile pruritis,atopic dermatitis,contact dermatitis,parasitic infestations,diabetes and liver or kidney pathologies.Without clinical examination,making a diagnosis is tough.So pls consult a dermatologist to rule out these possibilities one by one and reach a confirmatory diagnosis.Treatment is diagnosis specific.Hope it helps.Take care and pls do keep me posted on how you are doing or if you have any additional queries.
